CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 7, 1946, pg. 10, reads: "Solemn Rites - Solemn rights united Miss Louise Brit and John Spidell in holy matrimony recently. The bride is the daughter of Mrs. Julie Danill of Detroit, Mich., while the groom is the son of Mrs. and Mrs. James Spidell of the North Side.  A reception followed the ceremony.  The Rev. Cornell E. Talley, pastor of Central Baptist Church, officiated.  Bridesmaid was Mrs. J. Williams; C. Coleman was best man.  Mrs. G. Pearson and Mrs. Luella Bolden of St. Louis attended the rites. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of four men, possibly including best man C. Coleman, Rev. Cornell Talley second from right, and groom John Spidell, and two women including bride Louise Brit Spidell wearing short sleeved dress, detached sleeves, and corsage, and possibly bridesmaid Mrs. Williams, posed behind table with plates of crackers, fruit, and multi-tiered cake, another version
